metadata.title: TOMATO BATH|టమాటో బాత్|Perfect Tomato Bath Recipe|పక్కా కొలతలతో టమాటో బాత్ చేస్తే అందరు ఇష్టపడతారు
metadata.description: Learn how to make the perfect Tomato Bath (Karnataka Style Rava Bath) with exact measurements. This breakfast recipe is simple, quick, and tastes delicious. It's a great way to make a flavorful upma that everyone will love.

transcription_english: [00:00] Hello Foodies, Welcome to Vismai Food. Today's special is Perfect Tomato Bath.
[00:04] It tastes amazing when hot.
[00:06] You might think, 'Oh come on, they just add two tomatoes to Upma, why a recipe for that?'.
[00:11] But the real taste comes from the cooking method and correct measurements.
[00:15] This is exactly that. It turns out very perfect.
[00:18] This is an appreciation guaranteed recipe, trust me. Let's start Tomato Bath.
[00:22] First, add a cup of Bombay Rava (Semolina) in a pan and roast it on low flame until it gives a nice aroma.
[00:28] This must be roasted on low flame. Remember it takes at least 8 to 9 minutes to roast perfectly.
[00:35] After that, remove and let it cool.
[00:37] Now in the same pan, heat 1 tablespoon of ghee and 2 tablespoons of oil...
[00:42] Add a fistful of cashews and fry until golden red. Once fried, keep them aside.
[00:53] Now add 1 teaspoon mustard seeds, 1 teaspoon chana dal, urad dal, and cumin seeds and fry until reddish.
[01:00] After they are fried well and aromatic, add one finely chopped onion and fry for two minutes.
[01:07] Then add two chopped green chillies and 1 teaspoon chopped ginger and fry.
[01:14] Once the raw smell of onions is gone, add two chopped ripe tomatoes and cook them until soft.
[01:23] Once tomatoes are more than half cooked, add a small chopped carrot...
[01:30] And a quarter cup of fresh green peas and let the veggies cook. We used frozen peas.
[01:35] If you are using fresh peas, soak them in hot water for 30 minutes so they cook properly.
[01:41] Once vegetables are more than half cooked, add 1 teaspoon turmeric and a sprig of curry leaves, and cook veggies up to 80%, don't make them too soft.
[01:50] Now pour 3 cups of water. 3 cups of water for 1 cup of rava.
[01:56] Add salt to this and bring the water to a rolling boil on high flame.
[02:04] When the water is boiling, pour the rava while stirring well and let it thicken.
[02:09] Then cover and cook on low flame for another 3 minutes.
[02:18] After 3 minutes, sprinkle chopped coriander, mix well, and add the fried cashews.
[02:24] If you add cashews at the end, they retain their crunch while eating, otherwise they get soggy in the water.
[02:30] Now add 2 tablespoons of ghee, mix well and remove from heat.
[02:34] That's it! This Tomato Bath turns out very perfect.
[02:37] Don't worry about the water quantity being too much. As the rava cools down, it absorbs water and becomes dry. That's why we added 1:3 ratio.
[02:45] You can add another half cup if you want, it will stay softer as time passes.
[02:49] Did you like it? Then try it and definitely post the picture on Vismai Food Instagram sharing how it turned out for you.
[02:54] By the way, don't forget to visit vismaifood.com website.
